text:
@janasena2K24 @PbGovtIndia Dear Praveen,

We would like to inform you that the Tata Steel AEP 2024 results will be released by this Friday, October 25th.

Regards,
Team Tata Steel
https://t.co/CZsIix56bK

We are honoured to receive the Gold Award by the #BrandonHallGroup for the Best #TalentAcquisition Process.

Brandon Hall Group awards organisations human capital management programmes, strategies, processes and technologies that have achieved measurable results.

#TataSteel #WeAlsoMakeTomorrow #HRM

Sustainable operations are integral to our strategic goals and Tata Steel has launched the first carbon bank in India.” – T. V. Narendran, CEO & MD, #TataSteel.

Read More: https://t.co/S09PwT1P83

#1QFY25

(2/2)

Tata Steel India has delivered better margins aided by higher deliveries as well as realisations on a QoQ basis. Our domestic deliveries for the quarter stood at 4.78 million tons and were up 3% QoQ and 10% YoY.

(1/3) https://t.co/XY2dac8Kpc

I am happy to share that Tata Steel has received Safety and Health Excellence recognition for 2023 by worldsteel.” – T. V. Narendran, CEO & MD, #TataSteel.

Read More: https://t.co/XmJBs44qaA

#2QFY24

(2/2)

“Tata Steel India delivered steady performance, with crude steel production of around 5 million tons. Domestic deliveries were up 6% YoY, despite renewed volatility and seasonal factors during the quarter.

(1/2) https://t.co/CpUvOKW5Ef

#2QFY24 Financial Results: Our consolidated revenues for the quarter stood at ₹ 55,682 crores, while consolidated EBITDA stood at ₹ 4,315 crores. Despite seasonal factors, broad-based improvement was witnessed across key end use segments.

https://t.co/XmJBs44qaA

#TataSteel

We continue to progress on our sustainability journey and multiple initiatives are underway, calibrated to each operating location." – T. V. Narendran, CEO & MD, #TataSteel.

Read More: https://t.co/jiLoM1vCwJ

#1QFY24 #WeAlsoMakeTomorrow #FinancialResults  

(3/3)

“During the quarter, global economic recovery continued to face headwinds affecting commodity prices including steel. In India, domestic steel demand continued to grow and was up around 10% on YoY basis but steel spot prices moderated in line with global cues.

(1/3) https://t.co/DMzmdKI89g

We remain focused on cost optimisation, operational improvements and working capital management to maximise cashflows and will aim to resume our deleveraging journey in FY2024.” – Koushik Chatterjee, ED & CFO, #TataSteel

Read More: https://t.co/cke0VJogiw

#4QFY23Results

(2/2)

We continue to pursue multiple initiatives to reduce our emissions including a recently initiated trial for injecting large quantity of hydrogen into one of our blast furnaces at Jamshedpur, a global first." – T. V. Narendran, CEO & MD, #TataSteel. 

Read: https://t.co/cke0VJnIsY

“FY2023 saw our India crude steel production growing to around 19.9 million tons, with a 65% share of our overall volumes. The quarter also saw strong momentum with deliveries growing by 9% QoQ to 5.15 million tons.

(1/2) https://t.co/pdNmfkMBCr

#4QFY23 Financial Results: Our Consolidated Revenues for FY23 stood at ₹ 2,43,353 Cr., broadly similiar on YoY basis despite volatile operating environment across geographies. FY23 Consolidated EBITDA stood at ₹ 32,698 Cr. & Consolidated PAT stood at ₹ 8,075 Cr.

#TataSteel

We are presently expanding our capacities across multiple sites at Tata Steel Kalinganagar, NINL and the Electric Arc Furnace at Ludhiana in Punjab and at our downstream plants across India." – T. V. Narendran, CEO & MD, Tata Steel.

Read more: https://t.co/HBYVA2JMbt

(2/2)

#3QFY23 Financial Results: Our consolidated revenues for the first 9 months of FY23 stood at ₹ 1,80,391 Cr. (3% Growth YoY) and consolidated EBITDA stood at ₹ 25,472 Cr. with an EBITDA margin of ~14% despite volatile operating environment across geographies.

#TataSteel
